result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Michael Miller

records.addlTxt:
3:32 PM/ RM 203. Defendant Joshua Michael Miller in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has contacted PD Office and does qualify. Court advises Def. to follow up with PD Office. State notes did not receive status of counsel report yet.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

1:21 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Joshua Michael Miller appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. would like to have an Atty. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $1,500.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license and No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court questions Def. Def. responds. Court considers bail bond factors and orders a $300.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Court advises Def. of right to a P.H. within time limits and questions if Def. would like to go past time limits. Def. would like to waive time limits and wait for counsel. Court finds good cause and accepts waiver of time limits.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
